category_summary:
**Simon Willison** dominated today's AI discussions with hands-on assessments of current model capabilities and AI-generated code quality.

- **Willison** [expressed skepticism](/?date=2026-01-16&category=social#item-5020b51743a5) about whether today's models are ready for certain complex tasks, highlighting the skill gap in effectively using AI tools
- Multiple posts examined **AI-generated browser projects** (vibe-coded browsers), with **Willison** reporting [most are not in usable states](/?date=2026-01-16&category=social#item-74a0ab475377) despite successful compilation
- Technical deep-dive revealed one AI-built browser [genuinely attempted page rendering](/?date=2026-01-16&category=social#item-d73f77f1b1f5) rather than wrapping WebKit, evidenced by its rendering failures

The community tone reflects pragmatic realism about AI capabilities—enthusiasm tempered by real-world testing results.
category_summary_html:
Simon Willison dominated today's AI discussions with hands-on assessments of current model capabilities and AI-generated code quality.

  • Willison expressed skepticism about whether today's models are ready for certain complex tasks, highlighting the skill gap in effectively using AI tools
  • Multiple posts examined AI-generated browser projects (vibe-coded browsers), with Willison reporting most are not in usable states despite successful compilation
  • Technical deep-dive revealed one AI-built browser genuinely attempted page rendering rather than wrapping WebKit, evidenced by its rendering failures

The community tone reflects pragmatic realism about AI capabilities—enthusiasm tempered by real-world testing results.

themes.name: AI Model Capability Assessment
themes.description: Practical evaluation of what current AI models can and cannot accomplish, including skills required to use them effectively

themes.name: AI-Generated Browser Projects
themes.description: Discussion and evaluation of browsers built primarily through AI coding assistants (vibe coding), including attempts to compile and run them

themes.name: Technical Knowledge Sharing
themes.description: Discussion around technical blogging and sharing AI/ML experiences

items.title: I didn't think today's models were quite up to the task, and I thought it would take a while for the...
items.content: I didn't think today's models were quite up to the task, and I thought it would take a while for the skills needed to use models in this way to become widespread enough for people to take this on
items.author: @simonwillison.net
items.summary: Simon Willison expressing skepticism that current AI models were capable enough for a particular task, and noting the skills to use models effectively aren't yet widespread
items.reasoning: Direct insight from Simon Willison (highly credible AI practitioner) on model capability limitations. Fragment of larger conversation limits context, but offers honest assessment of current AI state from someone who tests extensively.
items.summary_html: Simon Willison expressing skepticism that current AI models were capable enough for a particular task, and noting the skills to use models effectively aren't yet widespread
items.content_html: I didn't think today's models were quite up to the task, and I thought it would take a while for the skills needed to use models in this way to become widespread enough for people to take this on

items.title: The version I got running definitely wasn't just wrapping WebKit, if it was wrapping WebKit it would...
items.content: The version I got running definitely wasn't just wrapping WebKit, if it was wrapping WebKit it would have been able to render a page properly!
items.author: @simonwillison.net
items.summary: Simon Willison noting that an AI-generated browser he tested was genuinely attempting to render pages (not just wrapping WebKit), evidenced by its failure to render properly
items.reasoning: Technical observation about AI-generated browser implementation details. Low engagement and requires thread context, but provides hands-on evaluation of AI coding capabilities.
items.summary_html: Simon Willison noting that an AI-generated browser he tested was genuinely attempting to render pages (not just wrapping WebKit), evidenced by its failure to render properly
items.content_html: The version I got running definitely wasn't just wrapping WebKit, if it was wrapping WebKit it would have been able to render a page properly!
